{include "affiliate_loader"} Congressman Adam Schiff to deliver keynote at special ACLU celebration. {include "pre-header-spacing"}{beacon}

{include "default_salutation"} –

Please join the ACLU of Massachusetts in celebrating and honoring 100 years of defending freedom at our upcoming Centennial Dinner! This is a once-in-a-century invitation: We hope you will join us on Saturday, May 9 to reflect on an incredible movement that began with just a small group of idealists.

We're thrilled to announce that our keynote speaker will be Congressman Adam Schiff. Congressman Schiff represents California's 28th Congressional District. He is Chairman of the House Intelligence Committee, and acted as lead manager for the impeachment trial of President Trump. Congressman Schiff is a Framingham, Massachusetts native and attended Harvard Law School.

We are also proud to honor DeRay Mckesson, a prominent civil rights activist, leading voice in the Black Lives Matter movement, and host of the award-winning podcast, "Pod Save the People." He is a client in Doe v. Mckesson, a national ACLU First Amendment lawsuit.

2020 Bill Of Rights Dinner

Please join the ACLU of Massachusetts for our 100th year celebration at the Annual Bill of Rights Dinner

Saturday, May 9, 5:30 p.m.
Boston Convention Center
415 Summer St.
Boston, MA 02210

RSVP Today


The ACLU has always been rooted in courage and guided by a vision: to extend the promise of civil rights and civil liberties to all people. The ACLU Centennial Dinner will honor our organization's legacy and those who continue to take action to create a more just and equitable nation for all.

Tickets and sponsorships for the dinner are available now. We hope you can join us on May 9!

Here's to the next 100 years!

ACLU of {affiliate_name}
